docs.title: Cloud Projects
docs.text:
• AWS (IAM, EC2, Lambda, S3, etc.)
  • Azure (App Services, Event Grid, CosmosDB)
  • GCP (In-progress)

docs.title: DevOps Projects
docs.text:
• Docker + Kubernetes Setup
  • CI/CD with GitHub Actions
  • Terraform basics

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: MkDocs Offline Documentation Setup Guide
docs.text: This guide walks you through a full offline-first setup of MkDocs with Material theme, including customization with CSS and project structure for technical documentation.

docs.title: 🚀 Installation Steps (Ubuntu/Debian)
docs.text:
1. Install Python, pip, and virtualenv:
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y python3 python3-pip python3-venv git
  1. Create project folder and virtual environment:
mkdir ~/my-docs
cd ~/my-docs
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
  1. Install MkDocs and Material theme:
pip install mkdocs-material

docs.title: 📁 Recommended Project Structure
docs.text:
my-docs/
├── .venv/                 # Virtual environment (not included in version control)
├── docs/                  # Markdown files (site content)
│   ├── index.md
│   ├── intro.md
│   ├── cloud.md
│   └── ...
├── assets/               # Optional custom assets (CSS, images)
│   ├── css/
│   │   └── custom.css
│   └── images/
│       └── bg.jpg
├── mkdocs.yml            # Site configuration file

docs.title: ⚙️ MkDocs + Material Setup
docs.text:
Edit mkdocs.yml:

site_name: My Offline Docs

theme:
  name: material
  palette:
    scheme: slate
  font:
    text: Roboto Mono
    code: JetBrains Mono

extra_css:
  - assets/css/custom.css

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Introduction: intro.md
  - Projects:
      - Cloud: cloud.md
      - AI: ai.md
      - DevOps: devops.md

docs.title: 🎨 Custom Theme with CSS (Optional)
docs.text:
Place this in docs/assets/css/custom.css:

/* Background for homepage */
body[data-md-page="index"] .md-main__inner.md-grid {
    background-image: url("../images/bg.jpg");
    background-size: cover;
    background-position: center;
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

/* Cool tech font + color scheme */
body {
    font-family: 'Fira Code', monospace;
    color: #40E0D0;
}

/* Transparent background boxes */
.md-content, .md-sidebar, .md-header {
    background-color: transparent !important;
}

.md-header {
    background-color: #012a2a !important;
}

docs.title: 🧪 Preview the Site Offline
docs.text:
Run locally with hot reload:

mkdocs serve

Visit: http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.title: 🏗 Build Static Site (for offline use)
docs.text:
mkdocs build

This creates a static site in the site/ directory. You can open site/index.html directly in any browser—no server needed.

To copy to another machine:

tar -czvf my-docs.tar.gz site/

docs.title: ☁️ (Optional) Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text:
If you want to deploy later:

  1. Make sure the project is a git repo:
git init
git remote add origin <your-github-url>
  1. Deploy with built-in command:
mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: ✅ Final Notes
docs.text:
• You do not need to be online to preview, build, or browse the final output.
  • Store and distribute the site/ folder to share it.
  • Use this guide for reproducible setups on air-gapped or legacy systems.
